required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness and Safety Evaluation of Aqueduct -100 Device
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness and Safety Evaluation of Aqueduct -100 Device

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the present clinical investigation is to collect data regarding the safety and effectiveness of the Aqueduct 100 device.
The effectiveness of the Aqueduct 100 will be determined by evaluating the ability to reach desired cervical dilation, and the time frame required to reach desired cervical dilation.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with dilation of cervix to a pre-determined diameter before the intrauterine procedure using Aqueduct-100 device.
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome of this study is to determine the effectiveness of the Aqueduct-100 device to dilate the uterine cervices to the desired diameter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of Adverse Events: rate, list and severity of AEs and SAEs.
secondary_outcome.description: In vivo safety evaluation of using Aqueduct-100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time frame required to reach desired cervical dilation from start time (insertion of device) to completion of dilation (removal of catheter)
Measurement of physicians' satisfaction with the device, through the use of a questionnaire.

arm_group.description: Uterine cervix dilation through Aqueduct-100 device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects, females, 18 years of age or older.
2. Subjects undergoing any process that requires dilation (intrauterine procedures).
3. Subjects understanding the nature of the study and willing to sign informed consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects younger than 18 years of age.
2. Subject with the following infectious diseases: HIV, HBV, HCV, Syphilis.
3. Subject has been treated with any cervix dilating agent within 2 months before the screening.
4. Known contraindications or hypersensitivity to the components of the investigational product.
5. The patient has a condition or a concurrent severe and/or uncontrolled medical disease which could compromise participation, compliance with, and/or completion with study procedures.
6. Subjects undergoing abortion <7 and >9 weeks of pregnancy.
7. Subjects unwilling to sign the informed consent form.
